tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage Vault: Oz 1985
programme.desc: From David Byrne to Midnight Oil, INXS, Models, Big Pig, The Church and more, rage delves into the Vault to bring you the best Australian Clips of 1985.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: Do we care too much about winning? To find out, Namila Benson enters a unique competition and talks to artists Abdul Abdullah, Jamie Cooper, Woopsyang and musician Nooky.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A hit and run and a stabbing death in a remote Northumberland valley have DCI Vera Stanhope and her team investigating the connection between the two people involved.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a seemingly simple kidnapping ends in murder, DI Neville Parker and the team must work out what went wrong and how someone ended up dead.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Bon Scott was set to become an international rock star with AC/DC in 1980 when he died suddenly. In 2022, his family and friends spoke for the first time about his vulnerabilities and state of mind before his untimely death.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: John and Bridget Preece are finally in a position to tackle the massive challenge of building a new home on the Chatham Islands - the remote archipelago 800 kilometres east of New Zealand with a population of just 600.

programme.title: Gardening Australia: Gardener Of The Year Special
programme.desc: We tour the gardens of five finalists for the 2018 Gardener of the Year award. Costa Georgiadis solves inner-city problems in Leigh Sales garden. Millie Ross shows how to make seeding pots from newspaper.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas, 1968. As astronauts embark on their latest space exploration, events continue to unfold at Nonnatus House. Sister Monica Joan believes this will be her last Christmas and may not get to see a man walk on the moon.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The arrival of a long-lost brother to a family-run golf club culminates in a body on the course. But a prime suspect with an alibi leaves the team with an impenetrable conundrum.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths meets artist Ben Quilty to explore the art that not only exposes what happens when the war is over, but helps veterans and their loved ones heal from it.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A special show featuring some of historys greatest firsts, including the first ever library, Olympic Games and people on the moon... plus the first ever rat roller skating on TV!

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Misplaced Mug
programme.desc: We meet the rather eccentric Georgian philosopher Jeremy Bentham; super-rich Roman politician Crassus raps about his blinging lifestyle; and Johannes Gutenberg goes head-to-head with some monks on The Historical Apprentice.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Cat Noir is suspected of theft, Ladybug has to prove that her partner is innocent and that a copycat is prowling around Paris. But will Ladybug be able to tell the truth from the false?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Oswald finally lands an interview on a famous Odd Squad podcast to talk about the new Mobile Unit van, but hes only familiar with the main floor. In an attempt to learn more, Oswald gets lost and risks missing his interview.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer returns from the fair triumphant - hes won a coconut! He soon discovers getting into the coconut isnt as easy as it seems.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Do you know how your lungs move inside your ribcage? The doctors investigate with the help of a massive water slide! Look out for Todays British Sign Language sign which is dinosaur.

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Giant gets his toughest test yet in Duel, and its an Eliminator for the ages as the contenders battle it out for a place in the grand final.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: The Moffatt Brothers attempt to recapture a record for parking a car in the smallest space possible, and a man lifts a woman with his beard.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Sad Little Sister
programme.desc: Special guest stars Al Murray and The League Of Gentlemens Reece Shearsmith, Mark Gatiss and Steve Pemberton join the Horrible Histories cast today for more fascinating facts, mirthful music and gruesome gags.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: After Alixs friends break her fathers priceless watch, she is akumatized into Timebreaker, travelling back in time to save the watch.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Torrential rain threatens to ruin the annual Sheep Dog trials, but The Farmer begs the judges for an opportunity to show off his talented Flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its poptastic! The doctors put your acoustic reflex to the test with an enormous balloon. And a serious case of snotting awaits the loser of todays Ouchology.

programme.title: Animals Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie films a pack of African wild dogs in Botswana to find out what it will take for the next generation of these endangered predators to survive.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews...
programme.desc: Louis Theroux travels between New York City and Madrid to spend time with one of Americas most polarising figures - the Iraq war whistleblower, activist and data security expert, Chelsea Manning.

programme.title: The Cleaner: A Clean Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and crime scene cleaner Wicky is looking forward to heading to the pub for Weasels Christmas raffle. All that stands in his way is a blood-soaked crime scene in an ice cream parlour.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal the turbinates - three incredible bones in your nose that warm up your snot so you can breathe clearly, and find out how scientists are growing a brain in Investigation Ouch!

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Dont You Disgrace Saiyan Cells! Vegetas Fierce Battle Commences!
programme.desc: Future Trunks challenges Black and Future Zamasu on his own. Goku, Vegeta, and Bulma hurry back to save him, but upon arrival, the time machine is damaged! This time the Saiyan prince is itching to dish out some payback!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers personal hygiene leaves much to be desired. Shaun, Bitzer and the Flock decide action is needed - and set about giving the Farmer a full service wash.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Malcolm McDowell takes the gang on a trip through time.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: In order to live under the sea the Bears must transform into mermaids.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit learns how things might have been if they hadnt joined the team, by using What-Would-It-Have-Been-Like-Inator helmets.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors make Billy Bones his very own bum and reveal the power of your gluteus maximus muscle! And find out who gets snotted in Ouchology.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The MythBusters put classic crime movie myths to the test to seperate Hollywood heist fact from fiction.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Lincolnshire to try to help downsizers Mark and Tina sell their detached three bed house. But the house is so over personalised, a prospective purchaser will never be able to picture themselves living there.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Moxie Jillette, Daxien, The Cosmic Romantics and David Schwartz.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Britain is on the verge of financial meltdown and Section D must recover over 1 billion pounds from one of the worlds most impenetrable banks.

programme.title: Rage Guest Programmer: Sharon Van Etten
programme.desc: Join Sharon Van Etten as she guest programs rage, bringing her signature mix of power and tenderness to the red couch, sharing the music thats moved her most.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law And Disorder In Johannesburg
programme.sub-title: Rosie Jones, Babatunde Aleshe And Brian Cox
programme.desc: Louis Theroux is in Johannesburg where residents find themselves increasingly besieged by crime. Many citizens turn to private security companies with brutal methods, to help protect them and their property.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Find out how amazing your hands are in todays lab when the doctors go head to head in a thumb challenge, and discover how drones are helping emergency rescue crews reach patients fast in Investigation Ouch.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Worship Me! Give Praise Unto Me! The Explosive Birth Of A Merged Zamasu!
programme.desc: Vegetas rage inspires Black to draw upon his own anger and unleash a devastating new ability. Mortal arrogance is proving to be a large enough thorn in Future Zamasus side that a permanent decision must be made!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer pops out for more supplies, Bitzer is left in charge of decorating and calls on the Flock for help. He soon realises this may be a terrible mistake as they have their own way of doing things...

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: I Put A Hex On You!
programme.desc: The Hex Girls need Mystery, Inc. for a cursed guitar.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears are invited to live with a family of cavemen but things get rocky when the bears teach the family about television.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: The Weight Of The World Depends On Orla
programme.desc: Orla shares the story of how she was chosen to protect the 44-leaf clover in order to stop the villain, Jellybean Joe, from causing oddness to the Mobile Unit van.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Gladiator Dynamite puts Dr Dan and Dr Raphs core muscles to the test, Dr Chris shoots hoops with a basketball dunking champ, while Dr Ronx is lifted into the air by finger power!

programme.title: BTN
programme.desc: Social Media Survey Results; PM Press Conference; International Reactions; Quitting Social Media

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Lincolnshire to try to help downsizers Mark and Tina sell their detached three bed house. But the house is so over personalised, a prospective purchaser will never be able to picture themselves living there.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In West Sussex, Phil helps Phil and Sandy Drake. Approaching retirement, this adventurous couple dream of travelling in their campervan with their dog. Theres just one small problem, they need to sell their house to do so.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: When Maggie falls for a suave Activities Director on a family holiday, Arthur suspects Ronaldo is out to exploit Maggie, while Robbies sure Liz is getting more than just upgrades from the Resort Manager.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Jedi younglings Kai, Lys, and Nubs go on their first adventure.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly are excited when they learn that Nanny Plum is a Tooth Fairy at night, and go along with her to pick up a little girls tooth. But the little girl is not so little - shes a human and much bigger than them!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man cover his car in cleaning foam. Great BigHoo and Toodloo investigate the spray nozzle. Toodloo manages to get it to work but when Chickedy and Chick have a go, the spray nozzle squirts foam everywhere.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Max Play At The Playground
programme.desc: Daniel feels left out at the playground when theres no room for him to play with Katerina and Max at the xylophone. Maxs big sister, Amira, helps them find a way for everyone to play.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing cant wait to voosh his new Hoppity Voosh Rocket Sledge in the snow, but after taking off his gloves to make a snowman, his hands hurt! When its time to go to Windy Hill, Bing has his reservations!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a new theme park: Potato City. There they discover that the magic of vegetables never ends.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Father Christmas pays a surprise visit to The Little Kingdom to check on the Christmas preparations. Everything is going according to plan until the King, the Queen and the Wise old Elf get trapped...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit gives Peppa and friends a tennis lesson, but the tennis balls get everywhere! So, the children play badminton instead and its a lot easier.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes guide a young Strawberrisaurus to find the courage to perform a special friendship dance that will help them find a lifelong playmate.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Walrus Chief
programme.desc: When Pesos precious medical kit is taken, Barnacles and Kwazii sneak into a dangerous walrus colony to get it back - disguised as a walrus!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are having trouble finishing their vegetables during dinner time so, Rosa and Pola have taken away the cake until they are finished.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Get ready to race with Leah and Luke! They are joined by Australian Sprinter Calab Law for a nail-biting running race between toys Maurice and Jemima, and commentate exciting field events with Owl, Joey, Fergus and Scrap.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Telephone Bird
programme.desc: Jay thinks they have discovered a new bird, the Telephone Bird! Nikhil wants to make it real for his brother and feeds his imagination as he helps him to find it.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum and Dad vow to only finish their boring housework when the kids stop acting silly, but thats never going to happen, so they end up trying the same approach themselves.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In the UK, find out how to make a clever corner creature in under a minute; in Hong Kong discover how to create a brilliant bottle bird; and in South Africa a Mini Maker has fun with some colourful tissue paper pieces.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Thomas friends notice hes glum about Percy being away for repairs on the Mainland, they try to help him by playing a game to see whos the best at cheering him up until Percy returns.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: PC Panda brings his twin daughters to playgroup Peggi and Pandora Panda. They love puzzles and to solve mysteries just like their dad.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets a nasty tummy ache, the Pea-Rexes have to find a special soothing herb which unfortunately is in the middle of Bananaraptor island!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: While working on a comic book of his childhood Cree stories, Mikisew tells the Dream Factory Crew about his tree fort and inspires them to hunt for the lost hang out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts must get two mantis shrimp to stop fighting before their powerful claw strikes destroy the Octopod.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Rebecca works with the Troublesome Trucks everyone expects the worst, but Rebecca defies expectations and has a very chucklesome day.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Alex and Justine are joined by Tim Minchin to make music and explore creative jobs! Justine is a painter, creating a masterpiece, and Alex snaps away as a nature photographer! Tim sings along to his book, When I Grow Up!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children about Chinese New Year. They learn about sweeping out the old year, and how lucky the colour red is and together they make a dragon costume to parade up the hill to watch the fireworks.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: A triple solar eclipse is about to happen! Cosima and Big Lizard race down the volcano and hitch a lift on a dragonfly to get vital equipment to Dad in the nick of time.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets are put in charge of running the lifeguard club all by themselves, it proves to be the toughest - and most rewarding - day of their lives.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton is left powerless after Romeo discovers how to stop him re-energizing. If Newton hasnt got super powers, is he still a hero?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Gets Locked Out On Christmas Day
programme.desc: Its Christmas day and the Browns get locked out. Will they get in in time for dinner and still have a merry Christmas?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and the presents have just been delivered to Father Christmas at the North Pole. Back at the elf tree, Mr Elf is sitting down to a nice cup of tea as Father Christmas rings up to say the toys are missing.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: A short-tempered Bibi attempts to not let Jestahs words get to her.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Yoda gives the younglings a mission.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants bread for his Royal breakfast, but there isnt any flour in the castle. Mr Elf takes Holly, Ben and Nanny Plum to the Elf Windmill to find out why it takes so long to make flour.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: Toodloo shows her balancing skills and Great BigHoo, while Chickedy and Chick run and roll out of the way.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel and his friends have to leave school early because theres a big snowstorm headed their way. Daniel is feeling frightened, but the grown-ups in his life are there to keep him safe.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and everybodys celebrating at Bings house! They all gather to open presents. Bing finally opens his Hoppity Voosh Rocket Sledge, but theres no snow! Bing waits for the snow to come.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to visit a house that Mr Bull is building. Who will their new neighbours be?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The children want to camp out for the night in the treehouse. Mr Brown is worried he wont get sleep as the kids will be scared. Paddington wants to prove him wrong, but a lightning storm means they have to come in doors.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and Father Christmas is making his deliveries to children around the world. Meanwhile King and Queen Thistle are stuck as well as the Wise Old Elf who is stuck in a Christmas tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are on a caravan adventure and the first stop is The Biggest Potato in the World. However, when it starts to get too foggy, they park up for a rest before another busy day.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Watermelonsuchus gets beached during a heatwave, Ginger and the Baby Pea Rexes have to get creative to work out a way to get the giant baby into the water.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Mixed Up Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts clean and repair their ship, the Octopod, the resulting noise causes a nearby Blue Whale to act in strange and dangerous ways.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: The whole family are in the car on their way to the seaside. However, they are currently stuck in a traffic jam for the ferry.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Miah and Zindzi make a splash with water sports! Olympic Diver Sam Fricker joins Miah to commentate a diving event between toys Little Ted, Kiya and Fergus. Zindzi, Miah and Sam perform a synchronised swimming routine.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Superstar Papaya
programme.desc: Jay is totally taken with a green papaya that Appa grew for a sambar dinner/recipe. Will they be able to find it when it goes missing?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Luckys Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle, but Bingo is forever losing.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South America the Mini Makers create a monster-sized plant picture; in Australia find out if he can make a bottle top cake in under a minute; and in Hong Kong a Mini Maker makes a cool creature with a fabulous fan.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel compete in an impromptu speed contest while carrying prized cakes for Sodors Cake Festival, they cause a disaster that really takes the cake... in fact, all of them!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family spend the day jumping in different types of puddles but one type is still the best puddle in the world.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger encounters an injured Mamma Pea-Rex who quickly befriends the baby Pea-Rexes. Ginger goes off to play alone and lands herself in trouble but is rescued by some unexpected friends.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their barber goes on vacation ahead of Robotics Team picture day, the Dream Factory Crew build a grooming robot to get themselves ready for their close-up.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts evacuate the creatures living around a reef before a large archway collapses, but one stubborn convict fish refuses to move from her burrow.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Tobys passengers cant stop making fun of him, but they soon change their mind when he stops two villains trying to steal King Godreds Crown.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Alex and Matt learn all about health care jobs! Nurse Ari explains how nurses take care of people, and Nurse Jemima flies her rescue helicopter to help injured toys! Matt the Vet visits Alex who is a very hoarse horse!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas Playgroup have a new friend to meet - Mandy Mouse. Mandy uses a wheelchair. The children have a lot of fun playing with Mandy as she is super sporty and loves to play games.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizards found an epic crystal and Cosima is jealous. Their squabbling peaks at the top of the volcano! Will they learn to share before its too late?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pirate Robot wants to upgrade his ship stuff from the Flying Factory.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington and Simi go on a magical journey into the human body to see if an apple pip grows into a tree if you swallow one.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly goes with Ben and Mr Elf to the elf farm to collect an egg for the Kings breakfast. While there a huge chicken escapes from the farm and Holly and the elves have to chase it across the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bams new powers are stronger than he can control!

programme.title: Rage Vault: Oz 1985
programme.desc: From David Byrne to Midnight Oil, INXS, Models, Big Pig, The Church and more, rage delves into the Vault to bring you the best Australian Clips of 1985.

programme.desc: John and Bridget Preece are finally in a position to tackle the massive challenge of building a new home on the Chatham Islands - the remote archipelago 800 kilometres east of New Zealand with a population of just 600.

programme.desc: We tour the gardens of five finalists for the 2018 Gardener of the Year award. Costa Georgiadis solves inner-city problems in Leigh Sales garden. Millie Ross shows how to make seeding pots from newspaper.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Christmas, 1968. As astronauts embark on their latest space exploration, events continue to unfold at Nonnatus House. Sister Monica Joan believes this will be her last Christmas and may not get to see a man walk on the moon.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The arrival of a long-lost brother to a family-run golf club culminates in a body on the course. But a prime suspect with an alibi leaves the team with an impenetrable conundrum.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths meets artist Ben Quilty to explore the art that not only exposes what happens when the war is over, but helps veterans and their loved ones heal from it.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Jessica Stewart, Rana Hussain and Bruce Djite discuss the AFLW Grand Final, the fallout from the First Ashes Test and take a look back on the biggest sporting moments from the year. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of homes left without power as a Category 3 cyclone tears through the Top End, grape growers grapple with forecast record low prices, and the holiday hotspots pricing people out of their own homes.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Charles Brice, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Melissa Mackay brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Melissa Mackay brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Discover the voices of young Australians as they share powerful, lived experiences from life in regional communities. Stories from the 2025 Heywire project that celebrate resilience, creativity and the spirit of the regions.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Hong Kongs deadliest fire in decades, severe flooding inundates Southeast Asia, plus Indonesias Oscars pick premieres in Australia.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Charles Brice, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.sub-title: Matt Keogh - Minister for Veterans Affairs and Defence Personnel
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas speaks with politicians and key players, plus what weve heard at the National Press Club and Senate Estimates.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.
